oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interview with Nāyfah Lūbānī
مقابلة مع نايفة لوباني
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Weddings--Songs and music
Short stories, Arabic--Palestine
Folk songs, Arabic--Palestine
Symbolism in literature
Political poetry, Arabic--Palestine
oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: al-Birwah Battle, 1948; Grooms; Harvesting; Military tactics; Zaffah; Caliphate; Conspiracy; Inheritance; Investigation; Jealousy; Maiden; Money; Murder; Snakes; Threats; Travel; al-Dāmūn (Palestine); al-Qassām, ʻIzz al-Dīn, 1882-1935; Arab countries; Arab Salvation Army; Birds; Dalʻūnā; Death; Expulsion; Grooms; Hawshah and al-Kasāyir Battle, 1948; Land sale; Loved ones; Martyrdom; Mayors; Palestinian resistance; Pilgrims; Prayers for rain; Rulers; Zaffah; Zionist Invasion of Palestine, 1948; Zionist occupation; Grooms; Pilgrims; Sūraṭ al-Fātiḥah; Wedding songs; Elderly people; Fathers; Generosity; Dwellings; Injustice; Kings; Murder; Poets; Praise; Princes; Sisters; Wives
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded in 1995 with Nāyfah Lūbānī, female, born in 1928 in al-Damūn, Palestine and resides in Nahr al-Bārid Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع نايفة لوباني عام 1995، أنثى، ولدت عام 1928 في الدامون، فلسطين وتقيم في مخيم نهر البارد للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان.
oai_dc:dc.dc:toc: Palestinian popular songs and political poetry. (@ 0:00)
Story of ʻAbdullātū and his siblings. (@ 6:5)
Islamic ruqyah from evil eye and Palestinian popular songs. (@ 35:31)
